Replies.Author: Chaeha
Replies.Content:
I gotta say this because it’s the funniest thing that happened today. Well, for me anyway.

So, the voice actor of Recruit is Kamiya Hiroshi. (last name first.) He also did (as I found out today) Zess from Broken Blade!

Then that 12-year-old just “happened to be” voiced by Hanazawa Kana, who played Kanade from Angel Beats.

Oh, I forgot to tell you Kamiya Hiroshi did Otonashi from Angel Beats.

It’s funny since Cleo likes Zess, just like Kanade likes Otonashi.

It would have been funnier if you showed BRS, because Hanazawa Kana is BRS.

Or, rather, Kuroi Mato, because I don’t think BRS actually says anything.

Or does she? It’s been so long I don’t remember.

Also at last week’s showing, Sakamoto Maaya played Nino-san from Arakawa and Mari from Evangelion,

and Koyasu Takehito played Sister from Arakawa and Aoba Shigeru (aka the operator whose name nobody remembers) from Evangelion.

I feel like you’re doing this on purpose…

And by Disappearance, do you mean Haruhi? Because I really wanted to see it but all I could find was the cam recording. Well, anyway, I’m gonna start looking into the voice actors/actresses to see if there’s any more connection.

This could be anime version of Kevin Bacon Game or something.

Replies.Author: Chaeha
Replies.Content:
This is important!

I did some research on my own, and I found out that the new Touhou anime is NOT official. Zun is NOT involved, but people from Animate says it’s collaboration, which makes it sound like official, which makes Touhou fans angry.

And the video you put up there (or the link to the video) is not the PV of the anime they are making. They made it as Reitaisai ad, or that’s the theory, and the Anime Tencho x Touhou anime is different, although they are made by same company. (Yes, it’s a company)

And as for the production, it’s ufotable. If you haven’t heard of them, they did Kara no Kyoukai movies, and many more. Yes, they are professional, which helps the misunderstanding of the anime being official to occur. And it also explains the quality.

The anime is basically Anime Tencho 10th anniversary stuff, so I don’t know why they would put Touhou. As a big Touhou fan, I don’t feel really happy about them using Touhou to advertise their mascot character… but I guess I can’t really complain since pros are making Touhou anime.

Long story short, whoever uploaded it on YouTube did not know what he/she was talking about, tricking us all (and probably him/herself). And as a big fan of Touhou, I am mad. Grrrr……

(It’s all from a reliable source. It’s basically wiki for/by Korean otakus, so they know stuff. One day I wrote about a Touhou doujin game I didn’t really know and put “please edit and/or add” tag, and next day, it had a full, detailed description of the game. It includes that it was made by an unknown doujin group, but it turned out to be a well-known group for bugs in the game. I mean, that kind of stuff is hard to find. And unlike ED of Uncyclopedia, they don’t do it for fun, but to actually share information, so you can trust them.)
